page.title: 06A TYPICAL DAIRY FARM.
page.content: {ACREAGE _}220 acres rented, 55 owned. {DAIRY HERD _}average number of cows 150 _ about 122 in milk.Friesian stock for a high milk yield.Milked twice daily, 6.30am and 4.30pm.Milking parlour allows ten cows to be milked together, and speedy throughput means milking lasts about one hour.Machines which take milk from the cows, convey it by individual jars to a cooling unit and into bulk tanks of 3,000 litre capacity.Milk is collected daily by bulk tanker and transported to a local dairy for retailing in liquid form.Average daily yield per cow is 20 litres.Concentrated feed is given whilst the cows are being milked which helps to give a better yield. Mastitis in the udder can be treated with penicillin.This milk is syphoned off to be used for calf feed.The milk is periodically tested by the Ministry
